resources.string: Benvinguda a easyauthenticator! Aquest assistents us guiarà en el procés de configuració inicial. Pareu atenció i llegiu atentament per tal d\'evitar la pèrdua de dades. \n\nNo patiu, podreu canviar qualsevol opció a Preferències.
Per tal de garantir la seguretat dels vostres comptes, easyauthenticator fa servir xifratge per a desar les dades. Aquí podeu triar el mètode de xifratge que s\'hi farà servir.

The KeyStore is a system component of Android used to securely store cryptographic keys. The advantage of using the KeyStore is that the keys are stored separately from easyauthenticator\'s data, and can be backed by hardware-based encryption (if your device supports it). However, as the keys are not stored with easyauthenticator\'s data, this method prevents external backup solutions (like Titanium) from working. If you choose this method, you will have to rely on the internal backup functions provided by easyauthenticator.\n\nWarning: The KeyStore is known to cause many problems, so please only use it if you absolutely have to. If you don\'t mind entering a password / PIN every time you start easyauthenticator, it is highly recommended to use the password-based encryption instead.

This method will encrypt your data with a key generated from a password or PIN. The main advantage of using this method is that external backup solutions (like Titanium) will work as expected, and it is much less failure-prone than the KeyStore. However, you will have to enter your credentials every time you start easyauthenticator.
Here you can setup an authentication method to lock easyauthenticator. Since you have chosen Android KeyStore as your encryption method, this step is optional.
